actions.text: Senate vitiated its action of June 13, 1974.
Measure indefinitely postponed in Senate, H.Con.Res. 537 passed in lieu.

official_title: Declares that it is the sense of Congress that 1974 be recorded as the year that all freedom loving Americans demonstrate a reaffirmation of their patriotism and love and respect for these United States of America upon the occasion of the 198th anniversary of it founding.

summary.text: Declares the 21 days from Flag Day, June 14, 1974, to Independence Day, July 4, 1974, as a period to honor America, and that there be public gatherings and activities at which the people of the United States can celebrate and honor their country in an appropriate manner.

titles.title: Declares that it is the sense of Congress that 1974 be recorded as the year that all freedom loving Americans demonstrate a reaffirmation of their patriotism and love and respect for these United States of America upon the occasion of the 198th anniversary of it founding.
